Comparison of costs: The expert analyzed the cost difference between Medicare and Medicare Advantage programs to determine if Medicare Advantage received overpayments or subsidies from taxpayers.
Assessment of patient outcomes: The expert investigated whether there was evidence to support the claim that Medicare and Medicare Advantage had similar patient outcomes, indicating that both programs were equally effective at keeping people healthy.
Evaluation of the: doughnut hole" closure: The expert assessed the feasibility of using the funds saved from cutting Medicare Advantage to close the "doughnut hole," a gap in prescription drug coverage for seniors.
Examination of convenience and additiona: The expert considered the convenience and additional benefits offered by Medicare Advantage plans, such as extra coverage or cash back through rebates on co-pays, to understand why some individuals preferred these plans over traditional Medicare.
